Title: N/A

reviewText: In terms of  entertainment value, I would rate these in the reverse order in which they are described in the descriptive lead-in to the reviews, that is, with Category 7 being the best and  The Black Hole a very creaky worst. All of them are B or C level films, the first two possessing modest quality, the third and fourth descending in that order to the almost ludicrous level. If you are really addicted, and have not gotten copies in the other collections, five bucks may be a good price to get the two better ones and perhaps like one or both of the others. If you are an average movie goer looking for pleasant but not quality entertainment,  you might enjoy one of these but should give some thought to getting  it in a different package with more of similar quality included.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Well for starters the films themselves are wonderful. They are not to high budget type films, but there pretty good. I had never seen THE BLACK HOLE, but not a bad story. Anyway now for the quality of the DVD's:Category 7:5/10 The picture is not all that bad neither is the audio(which is 2.0 Dolby Digital). Its just there is a lot of grain so grain haters beware.The Black Hole:8/10 Much better picture but the audio(Which is 2.0 Dolby Digital) is kind of rustyAbsolute Zero:9/10 Picture is great and so is the audio not bad quality for a made for TV movie.Disaster Zone:10/10 Picture and sound are perfect. This made for TV film is in absolute best quality for DVD.
